posts.body:
>>d8a6ccd4-7610-4f95-b7f3-f3396744605c
Right... I'm trying to keep updated about the 8chan situation, and I'm inundated with those Q-LARPing cultists. I sear they're worse than the furry community at this point.

>>a6b558fa-7593-4fc2-bc4b-b2d1ca204d26
The blacklist works by blacklisting user IDs, and since the boards are tied to a user ID, blocking the board owner blocks the board.
However, that doesn't block the users of that board. It'd be a lot of work to block all of the Q-cultists, so I'd just block them when you happen to run into them. Blacklisting someone will also delete any content by them on your PC too. I believe this isn't just limited to specific sites either, but across the entirety of ZeroNet itself.

>>be4b3ac4-caa7-4f3f-bf58-e7b3710376a6
>It isn't the real 8chan
No shit. this one is actually up and running.

>>eb3e3a53-0384-48aa-8b9f-71ea96f2b6d1
If these videos ever load, I'll help seed them.

>>1c0d9680-0c50-47eb-8c60-270a23f174fc
I'd own more guns and ammo if I got an extra $1000 per month.

>>95d4c665-6c3c-469b-8f43-6151df2f5325
Quietly mute or ignore the shills/slides and move on. Making a thread about muting shill/slide threads is just as bad as the shill/slide threads themselves.

>>2fd3719c-9c92-45d8-a7e0-844f40c9fb30
Either you're using tor and it's not seeding properly, you just downloaded a bunch of site content recently and it hasn't balanced out yet, or you have really bad upload speeds.
That's the only reasons I could think of at the moment.
I'm not using tor at the moment due to being lazy, so that might contribute a bit to my upload.

Edit: I notice your image shows a thumbnail, but the image won't load. This seems to be a common issue with tor, which would maybe suggest that your seeding issue may be due to tor (I'm a newfag at this stuff so I could be wrong).

>>7752f75f-0c12-451c-9476-9ff098a9d189
I believe the only way to stop seeding an image is by manually deleting it from your folder. Thumbnail images get downloaded and seeded automatically, if you click an image it too will download and seed, and I don't think you can disable that, unless there was some option to disable thumbnails/images from loading. A load on request option would probably be nice for thumbnails/images/videos.
